message: A new season of Game of Thrones is coming so lucky for us John Snow fans, ZTE has unveiled its smart Android TV set top box ZXV10 B860HV2. It works with Android applications and comes integrated with IoT tech. http://bit.ly/2oeyV0L

Huge congrats to Sun Bo, ZTE‚Äôs expert on technology standardization ‚Äì he‚Äôs won an award for his contributions to next-gen wireless network standards by the Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers. Your colleagues are proud of you! http://bit.ly/2nlynkx

We know that our innovative 4K-capable Android TV set-top box ZXV10 B860H delivers an exceptional TV viewing experience, and now one of the world‚Äôs premier TV Industry awards has agreed ‚Äì we‚Äôve won Best Consumer Device Award at TV Connect! http://bit.ly/2ok3kaz

Like watching video on your phone? So does the rest of the üåè, so it‚Äôs a good job we‚Äôve launched our Big Video Premium over-the-top solution. Revealed at TV Connect, the solution brings you the best video experience and helps operators save $. http://bit.ly/2mRT8Jm

It‚Äôs a Caribbean dream team: we‚Äôre partnering with Digicel to expand 4G LTE networks across the Caribbean (and Central America) to deliver the highest-performance mobile broadband services. http://bit.ly/2nKIcwn

ZTE‚Äôs Optics Labs set a new world record in 400G single-carrier signal transmission with its recent technology demo, recognized as one of the best research papers by the National Fiber Optic Engineers Conference in Los Angeles. http://bit.ly/2npKaAb
ZTE‚Äôs new GoldenData VAP solution uses #facerecognition #tech and #data retrieval analysis to identify people, vehicles #CeBIT http://bit.ly/2n17oLO

See how everyday life can be changed by Smart Street 2.0 solutions in our comic strip. In smart cities of the future, with one app, you‚Äôll be able to find the fastest driving route, open parking spots, electric vehicle charging stations and more.

Did you know that in 2016 at least 1.45 billion bits of personal information were leaked? To combat cyber-attacks ZTE‚Äôs revealed at CeBIT its adaptive cyber security solution, designed to safeguard your vital information online. http://bit.ly/2nPkwrB

ZTE has had a great time in Hannover at CeBIT and today ZTE launched its uSmartDC cloud data centre solution! Based on OpenStack architecture, the solution is optimised to provide enterprise-grade high service availability, performance, elasticity and resource efficiency. http://bit.ly/2myG4IU
ZTE is pleased to announce that in 2016 its full-year revenue rose to RMB101.2 billion, bolstered by growth in the company‚Äôs carrier networks and consumer businesses.

At CeBIT ZTE and Dusseldorf‚Äôs Health Department said that their eHealthcare pilot program has been a success: using sensors and intelligent analysis platform, the solution gives older people the confidence to remain longer in their own homes. http://bit.ly/2nanpAc

We‚Äôre pleased to announce a new partnership with German technology solutions provider Acal BFi. The deal, announced at CeBIT, means that Acal BFi can use ZTE‚Äôs advanced tech in their portfolio. http://bit.ly/2mXpPRN

Xu Ming, ZTE President of Strategy and Marketing, spoke at CeBIT on how we‚Äôre evolving Smart City 2.0 into 3.0 based on experience in Chinese cities and beyond. We‚Äôre moving to more integrated IoT and digital transformation! http://bit.ly/2nF9IM1

Very smart: ZTE announced at CeBIT that it is collaborating with three towns in Germany to transform them into a European model region for Smart Cities. The three sehr gut towns are R√ºsselsheim am Main, Kelsterbach and Raunheim. http://bit.ly/2nc3AtM

Straight after CeBIT, ZTE‚Äôs new collaboration with Semtech will bring GPS-free geolocation to LoRaWAN-based solutions in China, giving companies a low cost, easily implementable solution for a wide range of IoT applications. http://bit.ly/2mr7U9L

Also at CeBIT 2017, ZTE unveiled our Smart Street 2.0 solution, which helps city administrators better manage road services including smart parking and smart lighting while giving citizens real-time data via an app! http://bit.ly/2mPgk6N

At CeBIT 2017, ZTE and the China LoRa Application Alliance (CLAA) debuted a large-scale commercial Low-Power Wide Area Network (LPWAN) IoT solution. It‚Äôs part of ZTE‚Äôs commitment to building the IoT ecosphere for smart cities. http://bit.ly/2nhnJip

In a recent interview with Disruptive Asia, ZTE VP Yang Jiaxiao discussed how ZTE helps network operators with digital transformations. In 2017, ZTE will develop new custom M-ICT solutions with big data and AI for commercial uses. http://bit.ly/2n5vB6n

ZTE will be heading to London at the end of March for TV Connect for 3 days of innovation, discovery and strategy. As we enter the era of Big Video, ZTE has a host of premium video solutions to show you all! http://bit.ly/2mzs0Kf

We prioritize innovation at ZTE so guess how many patents we filed for our next-gen tech in 2016? See answer in comments below:
ANSWER: ZTE filed a massive 4,123 patents, making the company No. 1 on the World Intellectual Property Organization‚Äôs annual list. http://bit.ly/2nHkjT8

ZTE will be at CeBIT in Hannover on March 20-24, showcasing our Smart City 3.0 blueprint. See how we‚Äôre helping cities like Ningbo ease traffic and reduce emissions with smart transport systems using real-time Big Data analysis.

The platform provides agile development, continuous integration and service delivery for operators; enabling scenario-oriented user segmentation and enables on-demand functional customisation with rapid service release. http://bit.ly/2lbbioM

Watch our #MWC2017 Day 1 highlights reel: See ZTE 5G product innovations including FDD and TDD Massive MIMO, the preview of our new concept gigabit phone and a game of Whack-A-Mole with ZTE‚Äôs robot! http://bit.ly/2lneNUd

ZTE Corporation won the ‚ÄòInnovative Solution and Application‚Äô Award at the GTI Summit 2017 today for its enhanced Wireless Broadband (eWBB) solution, in recognition of its outstanding contribution to solution innovation and deployment.

Want a phone that takes hands free to the next level? Then you need Hawkeye, ZTE's crowdsourced eye-tracking phone that sticks to walls. Formerly known as Project CSX, the phone was the winner of a crowdsourced campaign that looked for innovative ideas at last year‚Äôs CES. http://bit.ly/2hWFKRT

This Pre5G solution enhances the commercial value of Massive MIMO and enables operators to multiply their network capacity using their current spectrum resources. bit.ly/2hxqDcw

Alongside our friends at the Houston Rockets, our annual #SeasonofGiving brought plenty of laughter and joy to those in need. ZTE became the official smartphone sponsor of the Rockets in October 2013, and since then every festive season we‚Äôve teamed up to give back to the local community.
